repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**refactor(message): propagate highlight id instead of attrs**

Problem:  Highlight group id is not propagated to the end of the message call
          stack, where ext_messages are emitted.
Solution: Refactor message functions to pass along highlight group id
          instead of attr id.

**feat(ext_messages): add hl_id to ext_messages chunks**

Problem:  Ext_messages chunks only contain the highlight attr id, which
          is not very useful for vim.ui_attach().
Solotion: Add highlight group id to message chunks, which can easily be
          used to highlight text in the TUI through nvim_buf_set_extmark():
          hl_group = hl_id.

Resolve #20310

comment_data.body: Originally deprecated here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/fa4c2601000df2d792b0de865da3ac8c43ab723f. With this change the original reasoning no longer holds so undeprecate?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -197,6 +197,7 @@ the editor.
 
 	The following keys are deprecated:
 
+	undeprecate?

comment_data.body: Adding `+ 1` at each call site is unfortunate. Do we want to adapt the enum and account for it elsewhere?
I'll adjust the enum to start with 1 in a follow up refactor, this is good enough for now.
`cmd_hl_id` (or maybe `cmdhl_id`). it is better to be consistent with always using `hl_id` elsewhere, never `hlid`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -49,7 +49,7 @@ struct cmdline_info {
   int cmdfirstc;                ///< ':', '/', '?', '=', '>' or NUL
   int cmdindent;                ///< number of spaces before cmdline
   char *cmdprompt;              ///< message in front of cmdline
-  int cmdattr;                  ///< attributes for prompt
+  int cmdhlid;                  ///< highlight id for prompt

comment_data.body: Did one more thorough pass myself of replacing `(hl)id` with `hl_id`😅
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -49,7 +49,7 @@ struct cmdline_info {
   int cmdfirstc;                ///< ':', '/', '?', '=', '>' or NUL
   int cmdindent;                ///< number of spaces before cmdline
   char *cmdprompt;              ///< message in front of cmdline
-  int cmdattr;                  ///< attributes for prompt
+  int cmdhlid;                  ///< highlight id for prompt

comment_data.body: Hmm, we probably should either calculate the actual hl_id, or just leave this change out completely (we can add it later if it is actually needed)
Right, think I just forgot about this one as a TODO, thanks. In the current logic it is always equal to `HLF_MSG`, added an assert to catch if that ever changes and more logic is needed.

comment_regular_data.body: What is the point of this?

> What is the point of this

Ran into this while still working on an internal replacement for the message grid. `extmark_set()` expects a highlight group ID, not attributes, so the ID needed to be preserved. See review comment.

Besides that, the point is that the highlight id is more useful than it's attributes for ext_messages consumers(#20310).

> What is the point of this?

A concise problem/solution description in each PR is very helpful. Even though https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/27811 also provides useful context, it's very helpful for each PR to say what problem it is solving.

@folke could you confirm that this would resolve the need for the workaround you mentioned in #20310?

If so, should I rebase this @zeertzjq @justinmk @bfredl or do you not think it's worth the churn?
Looks good at a quick glance. Please go ahead and rebase and I will do a final review.

title: feat(ext_messages): add hl_id to ext_messages chunks
